rules: Rule1: If the plant extract is approved, then the shipping of the product is scheduled.
Rule2: Under the condition that the product is ready for packaging, manufacturing of the product is complete.
Rule3: If the product has passed the stability test, then the final release check for the product has passed.

Rule4: Given that the product has passed the accelerated aging test, if the product has passed the stability test, then provided that the product has passed the quality check, when the formulation of the product is complete, the product is ready for packaging.

Rule5: Under the condition that the product has passed the real-time aging test, if the product has passed the stability test, then whenever the product has passed the quality check, given that the formulation of the product is complete, the product is ready for packaging.
Rule6: If the facility has proper storage conditions, then manufacturing of the product is complete.
Rule7: Provided that the facility is temperature-controlled, manufacturing of the product is complete.
Rule8: If the batch packaging is defective, then the batch labeling is incorrect.
Rule9: Provided that the batch labeling is incorrect, the product is misbranded.
Rule10: In the event that the batch labeling is incorrect, it is not the case that a recall of the batch is required.
Rule11: Under the condition that a regulatory violation has been found in the batch, if the product is misbranded, a recall of the batch is required.
Rule12: Either a regulatory violation has been found in the batch or a consumer complaint has been received for the batch.
Rule13: Whenever a consumer complaint has been received for the batch, if the product is misbranded, a recall of the batch is required.
Rule14: If the raw material is rejected by quality control, then the plant extract is not approved.
Rule15: Provided that the raw material is quarantined, the raw material is rejected by quality control.
Rule16: Under the condition that the raw material is returned to the supplier, the raw material is disposed.
Rule17: Given that the batch has passed the quality test, if the raw material is contaminated, it is not the case that the plant extract is approved.
Rule18: Provided that the shipping of the product is scheduled, the product is distributed to pharmacies.
Rule19: Whenever the drug is FDA-approved, the product is insurance-approved or, provided that the product is distributed to pharmacies, the product is released to the market.
Rule20: Provided that the clinical trial of the drug is successful, the drug meets efficacy standards.
Rule21: The drug is used off-label or, if the drug meets efficacy standards, the drug is FDA-approved.
Rule22: If the drug patent is applied, then the drug patent is pending.
Rule23: Provided that the drug patent is pending, the drug patent is granted.
Rule24: Given that the batch has failed the quality test, if the raw material is contaminated, the plant extract is not approved.
Rule25: Under the condition that a backup supplier is available for the ingredient, an alternative formulation is available for the product.
Rule26: A backup supplier is available for the ingredient or in-house production is possible for the ingredient.
Rule27: Whenever regulatory approval is obtained for the drug, the supply chain for the ingredient is not disrupted.
Rule28: If the product batch is documented, then manufacturing of the product is complete.
Rule29: Provided that the product batch is released, the product batch is documented.
Rule30: Quality assurance has signed off on the product or the production manager has signed off on the product.
Rule31: If the production manager has signed off on the product, then given that the formulation of the product is complete, the product batch is released.
Rule32: Whenever the supervisor has reviewed the batch, the batch has passed the quality test or the batch has failed the quality test.
Rule33: The supervisor has reviewed the batch or the technician has reviewed the batch.

Rule34: Provided that the quality director has approved the product, if quality assurance has signed off on the product, then whenever the formulation of the product is complete, the product batch is released.

Rule35: Under the condition that the operations director has approved the product, if quality assurance has signed off on the product, then provided that the formulation of the product is complete, the product batch is released.
Rule36: If regulatory affairs have reviewed the product, then the quality director has approved the product.
Rule37: Regulatory affairs have reviewed the product or medical affairs have reviewed the product.
Rule38: Provided that medical affairs have reviewed the product, the operations director has approved the product.

Rule39: If a release certificate for the product is issued, then provided that the product has passed the quality check, when the formulation of the product is complete, the product is ready for packaging.
Rule40: Under the condition that the facility has passed the compliance audit, if the final release check for the product has passed, a release certificate for the product is issued.
Rule41: Provided that the facility has passed the internal audit, if the final release check for the product has passed, a release certificate for the product is issued.
Rule42: If the external auditor has approved the facility, then the facility has passed the compliance audit.
Rule43: The external auditor has approved the facility or the quality system at the facility is effective.
Rule44: Whenever the quality system at the facility is effective, continuous improvement is implemented at the facility.
Rule45: Given that corrective actions are effective at the facility, the facility has passed the internal audit.
Rule46: Shipping containers are available for the product or palletizing equipment is ready for the product.

Rule47: If palletizing equipment is ready for the product, then the secondary packaging for the product is ready or, given that packaging materials are available for the product, the product is ready for packaging.

Rule48: Provided that logistics for the product are scheduled, the secondary packaging for the product is ready or, if packaging materials are available for the product, the product is ready for packaging.

Rule49: Under the condition that temperature monitoring is active for the product, if the cold chain is maintained for the product, then provided that shipping containers are available for the product, logistics for the product are scheduled.
Rule50: Temperature monitoring is active for the product or humidity monitoring is active for the product.
Rule51: Whenever the manager has approved the batch, if the technician has reviewed the batch, then the batch has passed the quality test or the batch has failed the quality test.

Rule52: The environmental controls at the facility are adequate or, if humidity monitoring is active for the product, then given that the cold chain is maintained for the product, whenever shipping containers are available for the product, logistics for the product are scheduled.
Rule53: If the equipment is sterile, then manufacturing of the product is complete.
Rule54: The equipment is sterile or the formulation of the product is complete.
Rule55: If the formulation of the product is complete, then packaging materials are available for the product.

Rule56: In the event that it is not the case that either the product has passed the accelerated aging test or the product has passed the real-time aging test, the shelf life of the product is established.
Rule57: Under the condition that neither the product has passed the accelerated aging test nor the product has passed the real-time aging test, the drug patent is applied.
Rule58: Provided that it is not the case that the product has passed the accelerated aging test or the product has passed the real-time aging test, the shelf life of the product is not established.
Rule59: If it is not the case that the product has passed the accelerated aging test or the product has passed the real-time aging test, then the drug patent is not granted.
Rule60: Under the condition that it is not the case that the facility has proper storage conditions or the facility is temperature-controlled, the facility is not humidity-controlled.
Rule61: Provided that it is not the case that if the raw material is contaminated, the raw material is quarantined, the raw material is returned to the supplier.

Rule62: In the event that it is not the case that if in-house production is possible for the ingredient, then provided that the formulation of the product is complete, the product is ready for packaging, the supply chain for the ingredient is disrupted.
Rule63: If it is not the case that if continuous improvement is implemented at the facility, corrective actions are effective at the facility, then an audit finding is pending at the facility.

Rule64: Under the condition that it is not the case that if continuous improvement is implemented at the facility, corrective actions are effective at the facility, it is not the case that an audit finding is pending at the facility.

Rule65: Provided that it is not the case that if it is not the case that the facility has proper storage conditions or the facility is temperature-controlled, the facility is humidity-controlled, the batch packaging is defective.
Rule66: If regulatory approval is not obtained for the drug, then market authorization is granted for the drug.
Rule67: Whenever regulatory approval is not obtained for the drug, market authorization is not granted for the drug.
Rule68: Under the condition that manufacturing of the product is not complete, the plant extract is approved.
facts: Fact1: The product has passed the quality check.
Fact2: The product has passed the stability test.
Fact3: The raw material is contaminated.
Fact4: The clinical trial of the drug is successful.
Fact5: The cold chain is maintained for the product.
Fact6: The manager has approved the batch.
Fact7: The raw material is not disposed.
Fact8: The product is not released to the market.
Fact9: The product is not insurance-approved.
Fact10: The drug is not used off-label.
Fact11: An alternative formulation is not available for the product.
Fact12: The secondary packaging for the product is not ready.
Fact13: The environmental controls at the facility are not adequate.

question: Manufacturing of the product is complete.
